_header: I mourn for love thou may see
_description: A couplet in a Latin homily ‘Amore Langueo’

OxfBal149.Transcription:
y morne for loue þu may seeþat makide me deye for
                    þe
OxfBal149.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.131.

OxfMagd93.Transcription: y morne for loue thou may seethat makith me dye for the

CULKk424.Transcription:
I morne for loue þu may seþat makyth me to dye for
                    þe

TCD277.Transcription:
I morne for luffe (line 4 on page)I morn for lofe þu may
                    seeþat made me drery for þe (lines 6-7)
TCD277.Note: In a sermon for Good Friday.
TCD277.Attributed Title:
Amore Langueo (p. 185); Sermo de passione Cristi in die
                        parasceues facienda (added, p. 185)
